div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Joseph H. White, [n.d.]
div1.p: Mem (For assistant Surgeon General J. H. White)

Dr. Frost has also compiled a bibliography
of Father's writings on yellow fever and
malaria. I would enclose my copy, but have
only the one and need it in my work. You can
of course, get a copy from him if you wish it.

By the way as you doubtless already know the “Malaria Catechism ” (Supple-
ment No. 18 to the Public Health Reports) has not
only had a tremendous circulation in its
English edition, but has been translated into

Spanish and Portuguese. The last
time I know of this being done was
by the Journal of the Pan American Union. The
1st Span. edition translation of which
I heard was made about 1915 or 1916.
This “catechism” was written between
Sunrise and breakfast, the only free
time Father and I had in the spring of 1914,
as he had a lot of hospital work (station=Baltimore)
and also was preparing to go off on field work. We
just did finish it before he started.
